item.title: Mahalo and Farewell
item.description:
To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly. - Henri Bergson

Hi there, folks üëãüèº

As life advances, and we adapt to these changes, I realized that I don't feel compelled to write tutorials and how-tos posts anymore üçï. In the past few years, I have been working in many environments, from big corporations to small startups. And as my level of seniority changes, working on more complex and private projects, I realized it's time to say goodbye to chmod a+x singularity.

But it's funny to look back and think about our journeys and stories.

I started this website in 2014 when I was about to graduate from my Ph.D. in Physics in Stony Brook. Those were the days when I was so so thirsty about learning everything about computers! I wrote an entire book on Python & Algorithms, and I was playing CTF intensively and top 30 on CTFTimes.org. I had that üî• to learn everything and write about everything (hence the the variety of topics that this blog has üòÖ).

Creating nerdy has been a trend in my life. When I was a kid, I wanted to be a scientist and a computer engineer. I wrote my first (Flash) website when I was 11:

Funny how I had texts on AI and C++ and Java back then... Certain things don't change (but MP3s do ü§£).

Then I created another website when I was in college, and when I was in my Ph.D. (so many papers here, I love this website!). Finally, I wrote singularity.sh, and I feel like my journey has ended with style üëæ.

Thank you all for following my work, for reading my posts, and for cheering my journey. It was an honor to be here, and I will see you on the flip side.

Mia or Marina or Bt3gl or bt3 or bytegirl ‚ô•Ô∏è
